title: Protecting Certain Property of Da Afghanistan Bank for the Benefit of the People of Afghanistan

enrichment.summary: This executive order blocks and protects certain assets of Afghanistan's central bank held in U.S. financial institutions to prevent their transfer or use amid a humanitarian and economic crisis in Afghanistan. The order aims to ensure these assets are preserved for the benefit of the Afghan people while addressing national security concerns.
potential_concerns: Blocking Da Afghanistan Bank assets may limit funding accessible for humanitarian aid, potentially worsening food insecurity among Afghan civilians.
Preserving central bank assets while preventing claims by terrorism victims could lead to legal disputes causing delays or reduction of compensation for terrorism survivors.
The economic sanctions embedded in the order could deepen Afghanistan's financial crisis, negatively impacting the general population's livelihoods and basic needs fulfillment.
The consolidation of blocked assets at the Federal Reserve may complicate or slow disbursement of aid funds, inadvertently harming foreign nationals reliant on timely economic assistance.
